channel.title: WSJ.com: World News
channel.copyright: Copyright © Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All rights reserved.

item.title: Pope Francis Dies, Triggering Succession Process
item.description: Catholics around the world will be watching to see whether his successor upholds Francis’ progressive legacy or tacks toward a more traditional pontificate.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: Among Last to Meet Pope Francis: JD Vance
item.description: In his final hours, Pope Francis met the vice president and delivered an Easter message on a theme that was central to his papacy: an appeal for better treatment of migrants.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: Pope Francis, Advocate for Economic and Social Justice, Dies at 88
item.description: The pontiff urged grassroots activists around the world to bridge the gap between rich and poor while calling on wealthier countries to protect the environment.
item.dc:creator: Francis X. Rocca

item.title: Israeli Probe Finds Failures, Breaches of Orders After Soldiers Kill 15 Gaza Aid Workers
item.description: Military found troops errantly believed they were under threat and fired a field commander for a misleading description of events.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: ‘I’m Not a Criminal’: The Mexican Politician Suspected of Being in Bed With Cartels
item.description: The governor of Sinaloa faces growing scrutiny after a spectacular kidnapping and mysterious murder amid a cartel turf war.
item.dc:creator: José de Córdoba

item.title: Sweden Has the Tanks. Finland Has the Troops. Welcome to the Pan-Nordic Army.
item.description: Nordic countries are pooling resources to counter Russia amid uncertain security guarantees from Trump’s White House.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: Breakdown in U.S.-China Relations Raises Specter of New Cold War
item.description: What is at stake as economic ties careen off the rails is overall global security and economic stability for years to come.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: Kyiv Is On the Clock to Respond to Trump Plan to End Ukraine Conflict
item.description: The U.S. proposal includes recognition of Russia’s annexation of Crimea and blocking Ukraine from joining NATO.
item.dc:creator: Alan Cullison

item.title: Argentina’s Milei, a MAGA Superstar, Is Bucking Trump on Trade
item.description: The libertarian leader’s slash-and-burn approach to tariffs and import restrictions puts him out of step with the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dubé

item.title: Ukraine Says Russia Carries On Attacks After Putin Declares Easter Cease-Fire
item.description: Russian president had called for a 30-hour halt to attacks in Ukraine if Kyiv also agrees to a truce.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Putin’s War Economy Can’t Escape Trump’s Trade Blitz
item.description: Russia dodged “Liberation Day” tariffs, but Moscow is still perilously exposed for one reason: oil.
item.dc:creator: Alan Cullison

item.title: Border Crossings Grind to Halt as Trump’s Tough Policies Take Hold
item.description: Illegal crossings at the southern border are at their lowest levels in decades, a trend that began before the election and has continued under President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: Iran Says Talks With U.S. to Continue After ‘Positive’ Meeting
item.description: Iran and the U.S. concluded a new round of talks in Rome in what Iranian officials described as a step forward, with further talks to continue soon.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Trump Endorses Covid ‘Lab Leak’ Theory on Government Websites About the Virus
item.description: Updates to Covid.gov lay out the president’s view that the deadly virus originated in a laboratory in Wuhan, China.
item.dc:creator: Christopher M. Matthews

item.title: Big Gaps in Intelligence on Iran’s Nuke Program Threaten Push for Quick Deal
item.description: U.S. and Iranian officials are convening in Rome for a second round of discussions on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: India Has a Golden Opportunity to Capture U.S. Business From China
item.description: The world’s most populous nation has long trailed not just China but also smaller countries with nimbler governments.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Beijing Stokes Patriotic Fervor and Blames U.S. for Trade War
item.description: The Communist Party is steeling China’s population for an ideological battle. It is an approach that could backfire.
item.dc:creator: Brian Spegele

item.title: Senator Says Margarita Photo‑op With Abrego Garcia Was Staged by Salvadoran Leader
item.description: Sen. Van Hollen claims drinks in viral image with detained U.S. migrant were planted by officials in the Central American country
item.dc:creator: Ginger Adams Otis

item.title: U.S. Will Pause Ukraine Peace Efforts if No Progress, Trump Warns
item.description: The secretary of state, in earlier remarks aimed at putting pressure on both sides to compromise, said Washington had presented a framework for a deal to Kyiv and Moscow.
item.dc:creator: Michael R. Gordon

item.title: U.S. Accuses China of Helping the Houthis Target Their Attacks
item.description: Allegations against a satellite-imaging company highlight growing military support from Beijing and Moscow.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Tiny Russian Exclave Flexes Might in NATO’s Backyard
item.description: Moscow’s forces recently carried out military exercises around Kaliningrad, sending a message to the West.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Betty Webb, Who Quit School to Keep Secrets for Britain During WWII, Dies at 101
item.description: She was part of a code-breaking operation, and spent the last decades of her life talking—and learning more—about her experiences
item.dc:creator: Chris Kornelis

item.title: How China’s Boeing Ban Threatens to Backfire on Its Own Plane Maker
item.description: Upstart manufacturer Comac is dependent on U.S. technology and has relatively few planes in the air.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: U.S. Toughens Demands on Syria’s New Islamist-Led Leadership
item.description: The Trump administration wants Damascus to crack down on extremists and expel Palestinian militants in return for a limited easing of sanctions.
item.dc:creator: Nancy A. Youssef

item.title: Europe Cajoles U.S. Into Talks Over Ukraine
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron hosted Steve Witkoff and Marco Rubio in an attempt to carve out room for Europe in Washington’s talks with Moscow.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lytvynenko

item.title: Trump Expresses Optimism on EU Trade Deal
item.description: The president spoke during meetings at the White House with Italy’s prime minister, Giorgia Meloni, who invited Trump to Italy and to meet EU officials for trade talks.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Bade

item.title: Lebanon’s Government Arrests Militants, Asserting Its Authority
item.description: The government’s authority has grown after Israeli strikes battered Hezbollah’s top leadership and devastated its ranks and arsenal.
item.dc:creator: Adam Chamseddine

item.title: El Salvador’s Bukele Plans to Double the Size of Giant Prison Holding U.S. Deportees
item.description: President Nayib Bukele told Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem he plans to expand the sprawling prison compound known as Cecot when she visited last month.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Hackman

item.title: U.K. Supreme Court Rules Trans Women Can’t Be Defined as Women
item.description: The decision could have far-reaching implications for the protections and freedoms given to transgender women in the U.K.
item.dc:creator: Gareth Vipers

item.title: Xi Fights Trump’s Tariffs With Global Charm Offensive
item.description: The Chinese leader is seeking to win over trade partners caught between U.S. tariffs and oversupply by his country.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: Attacks on Darfur Relief Camps Threaten Bloody New Chapter in War
item.description: Fears are growing that a rebel militia is using violence to consolidate control in the famine-stricken region of Sudan.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Canada’s Carney Warns of Further Auto Fallout With Trump ‘Attacking’ Domestic Sector
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said he and other senior officials have spoken with senior executives at the world’s biggest automakers.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Meet the Russian Dubbed ‘Putin’s Brain’ Who Is Courting Trump Supporters
item.description: Alexander Dugin, a longtime fixture of Russian far-right politics, has become one of the hottest guests on MAGA podcasts.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Osipovich

item.title: In the Other Gaza, Trump’s War on Waste Baffles Mozambique
item.description: The White House claimed U.S. aid workers shipped 3.3 billion condoms to Hamas. They didn’t.
item.dc:creator: Michael M. Phillips

item.title: Putin’s Secret Dealmaker Emerges From the Shadows in Ukraine Peace Talks
item.description: Sergei Beseda, known to the CIA as ‘the Baron,’ also figured in one of the world’s biggest prisoner swaps.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Trump Envoy Makes Push on Ukraine Peace Talks in Meeting With Putin
item.description: The Trump administration pressed to advance the Ukraine peace negotiations that have stalled in recent weeks.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: Al Qaeda Punctures Kenya’s Dreams for an Indian Ocean Trade Hub
item.description: Militants based next door in Somalia have stalled the $25 billion plan for an economic corridor across Kenya’s impoverished north.
item.dc:creator: Michael M. Phillips

item.title: While War Rages, Congo’s Neighbors Smuggle Out Its Gold and Mineral Wealth
item.description: The vast country is struggling to prevent Rwanda and Uganda from seizing some of its most valuable assets.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: World’s Newest Country Teeters on Edge of Civil War
item.description: A standoff between the president and his deputy is threatening to tip South Sudan back into ethnic conflict.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: In Vietnam’s Streets and Factories, Boom Built on U.S. Trade Suddenly Looks Fragile
item.description: As Trump’s 46% tariffs loom, one furniture factory owner has a sore throat from talking to so many customers to renegotiate orders.
item.dc:creator: Jon Emont

item.title: North Korea Reaps Military Secrets From South Korean Mayhem
item.description: The events that triggered the ouster of South Korea’s president paralyzed state affairs—while delivering an intelligence windfall to the country’s archnemesis.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: Comedian Russell Brand Charged with Rape and Sexual Assault in U.K.
item.description: The allegations came from four women, London’s Metropolitan Police said.
item.dc:creator: Roshan Fernandez

item.title: Race for South Korea’s Next Leader Starts With Dismissal of President
item.description: Yoon Suk Yeol’s ouster over his martial-law decree triggers a snap vote to elect a leader who will face challenges on trade, U.S. relations and North Korea.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: How North Korea Cheated Its Way to Crypto Billions
item.description: More than $6 billion from heists highlights the sophistication of cyber operations funneling cash to Kim Jong Un’s nuclear program.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: The Brutal War Complicating Myanmar’s Quake Response
item.description: Last week’s violent earthquakes tore through a part of the country that had already borne the brunt of a brutal campaign by the country’s military junta to root out resistance.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: U.K. Prices May Cool as Tariffs Rise, BOE’s Dhingra Says
item.description: Global prices fell in response to higher tariffs during Trump’s first term as sellers in China and other countries lowered their prices to find other buyers, the Monetary Policy Committee member said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Airlines Battle to Recover After London Heathrow’s Day in the Dark
item.description: Carriers are working to rebook stranded passengers while getting aircraft and flight crews back in position.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Katz

item.title: Modi Positions India as Ally in Trump’s Illegal-Immigration Fight
item.description: India’s leader has supported the deportation of Indian citizens as New Delhi looks to safeguard U.S. relations and protect H-1B visas.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: This Indian Festival Hosts More Pilgrims Than the Population of the U.S.
item.description: At least 400 million people are estimated to have attended the event, believed to be at least two millennia old and now drawing to a close.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Trump Calls India a Tariff King, a Title Modi Wants to Shed
item.description: With tariffs on imports averaging 14%, India is especially vulnerable to the reciprocal levies Trump says he will impose on some countries.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: India Has a Caste System—for Drivers
item.description: Lawyers, journalists and other members of the country’s educated class say their jobs entitle them to special treatment on the road; ‘Rich brats’
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
